intro: Hieracium colpophylloides, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of leaves that are rough and hairy. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium colpophylloides is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
